f1.frase: Busy minds, clean souls and contented hearts never meddle in anyone's life.

f2.frase: The person who asks is dumb for a minute. The person who stays in doubt remains a fool forever.

f3.frase: Just as iron rusts from lack of use and stagnant water becomes putrid, so does inactivity destroy the intellect.

f4.frase: Whoever wants to do something, finds the means; whoever doesn't want to, finds a thousand excuses.

f5.frase: Logic will take you from A-Z, but imagination will take you everywhere.

f6.frase: Expecting life to treat you well because you are a good person is like expecting a tiger not to attack you because you are a vegetarian.

f7.frase: Watch your thoughts, for they will become your words. Take care of your words, because they will become your actions. Watch your actions, because they will become your habits. watch your habits, because they will become your destiny.

f8.frase: We are architects of our own destiny.

f9.frase: Try not to become a man of success, but a man of courage.

f10.frase: Among the difficulties lies the opportunity.

f11.frase: I don't need to know everything, I just need to know where to find what I need, when I need it.

f12.frase: The mind that opens to a new idea never returns to its original size.

f13.frase: I feel enormous gratitude for all those who said no, thanks to them I did it myself.

f14.frase: We live in a world in which truth is overshadowed by a reality that does not exist.

f15.frase: The intelligent person is not the one who knows everything, but the one who knows how to use the little he knows.

f16.frase: If you are not grateful with what you have, what makes you think you would be happy if you had more?

f17.frase: We spend money we don't have, on things we don't need, to impress people who don't care about us.

f18.frase: May your only vice be to keep learning.

f19.frase: You have to learn the rules of the game and then play better than anyone else.

f20.frase: The devil whispered in my ear, -You are not strong enough to withstand the storm. Today I whispered in the devil's ear, -I am the storm.

f21.frase: Everything you want in life is outside your comfort zone.

f22.frase: God did not create evil. Evil is the result of the absence of God in the hearts of men.

f23.frase: The biggest obstacle that prevents people from achieving success is having a factory of excuses in their mind.

f24.frase: Strength does not come from bodily capacity, but from the will of the soul.

f25.frase: Remember that just because you hit bottom doesn't mean you have to stay there.

f26.frase: If you want to be rich, look at what everyone else is doing and do the opposite.

f27.frase: It doesn't matter how slowly you go, as long as you don't stop.

f28.frase: Men lose health to make money, and then lose money to regain health, and by anxiously thinking of the future, they forget the present. They live as if they would never die and die as if they had never lived.

f29.frase: He who denies his impulses is denying everything that makes us human.

f30.frase: Living in the world without being aware of its meaning is like wandering through a large library without touching its books.

f31.frase: True intelligence acts silently. It is in stillness that we find creativity and solutions to problems.

f32.frase: By being true to yourself you cannot be false to others.

descripcion.tx2: It introduces MVC(Model-View-Controller) for the client side, as well as bidirectional data binding.
descripcion.tx3: The major overhaul of Angular was as of version 2 in 2016, given the major requirement on performance and scalability for large applications.
descripcion.tx4: Angular is in the group of the best web frameworks, every 6 months without fail delivers a new version and has been allowed to evolve. Today it has been adopted in many business projects for the features that make it particular. The community is getting bigger and bigger becoming popular and standing out as an excellent choice in the development world.
descripcion.tx5: Personally it was my start in the world of Development and I have always been hand in hand with this wonderful framework.

descripcion.tx1: In a need for presentation standards between 1994 and 1996 Håkon Wium Lie and Bert Bos first proposed the idea of CSS in 1994. Version 1.0 was introduced in 1996 as a solution to separate the structure of the HTML document from its presentation.
descripcion.tx2: In December 1996, the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) published the first official CSS specification, known as CSS 1. This version included basic properties for page layout, such as color, font and margin.
descripcion.tx3: Then the changes started to make a bigger difference from 1998 onwards, with capabilities for tables and printing properties.
descripcion.tx4: As developers today we are already aware that styles are subject to browser versions. In the past, it was really complicated to write code that would adapt to different browsers. That is why version 2.1 was launched in 2004, which sought to correct the inconsistencies that were presented, as a new version is presented, and the maturity and adaptation has grown, allowing an evolution that facilitate the styles and presentation.

descripcion.tx1: Being a common principle, some of us who started in programming started in the Web and it is undoubtedly that for some it was difficult to understand how to apply a class or each option that the DOM makes available with CSS styles.

css-clases.descripcionCorta: Detailed explanation for CSS class styles. Particularly it was the way I always expected to find an explanation in google searches.

descripcion.tx1: In 2011 Google announces a new programming language, where the goal was to overcome the limitations of Javascript in terms of performance, maintainability and scalability.
descripcion.tx2: In 2013, version 1.0 of the SDK appeared, showing itself as an adaptable option for web design.
descripcion.tx3: From 2011 to 2015 he had a career focused on web development, where he introduced a 'Dartium' engine used in the Chrome browser for and can be used directly the Dart language.
descripcion.tx4: Incredible a version of AngularDart, a framework to be used in AngularJS in exchange for Javascript in 2013, as well as being in collaboration with the Web Components project.
descripcion.tx5: Now in 2015 with Flutter, where he found a revealing path towards cross-platform mobile applications.
descripcion.tx6: Now connected to Flutter, they begin to expand a community that is seduced by the attractive designs and performance that comes in version 2 of this language.

dart.descripcionCorta: Dart, with its ups and downs, enters the arena again with Flutter, however it is important to know what advantages it offers over other languages in order to choose it.

descripcion.tx1: Famous for Flutter, Dart's framework allows you to create applications of many types focused on powerful web development.

dart-elementos.descripcionCorta: Description of the elements that are part of Dart. Additional suggestions for other kinds of applications.

descripcion.tx1: The beginning of databases seems to date back to earlier times than the current technologies, many of which have emerged in recent years.
descripcion.tx2: In 1960, in its first attempts, a network model had been proposed through a network structure. IBM launched the database management system (DBMS) IMS (Information Management System) in 1966.
descripcion.tx3: In 1960, with the help of Charles Bachman, the hierarchical model was developed, which organizes data in a tree structure.
descripcion.tx4: As time went by, changes were applied up to the current database versions, in this case already in 1970, Edgar F. Codd, an IBM computer scientist, proposed the relational model in his article "A Relational Model of Data for Large Shared Data Banks" in 1970. This model is based on interrelated tables, and is the basis of modern relational databases.
descripcion.tx5: As early as 1974 IBM released the first structured query language (SQL) as part of the System R system (a database system built as a research project at IBM's San Jose Research Laboratory).
descripcion.tx6: In 1977 Larry Ellison, Bob Miner and Ed Oates founded Oracle Corporation, launching its first relational database product, Oracle Database, in 1979.
descripcion.tx7: In 1986 ANSI adopted SQL as a standard, which boosted interoperability between database systems. Several commercial relational database systems, such as Microsoft SQL Server, Sybase, and Informix, were released in the 1980s.
descripcion.tx8: In 1995 the initial version of MySQL was released, providing an open source relational database option.
descripcion.tx9: In 1998 the term "NoSQL" was coined in this decade, NoSQL database systems, such as MongoDB, CouchDB and Cassandra, expand their popularity.
descripcion.tx10: Already in the 2000s comes 'Big Data' with solutions such as Apache Hadoop and Apache Spark provided tools to process large data sets. Emergence of NoSQL Databases: MongoDB (2009), Couchbase, and other NoSQL databases became popular for specific use cases, such as managing large volumes of unstructured data.
descripcion.tx11: Cloud Databases: Cloud database offerings, such as Amazon RDS, Google Cloud Firestore and Azure Cosmos DB, became popular options, allowing companies to outsource their database management.
descripcion.tx12: GraphQL (2012): Facebook launched GraphQL as an alternative for efficient data access, allowing customers to request only the information they need.
descripcion.tx13: 2020s - Continuation of Previous Trends: Machine Learning and Databases: The integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning into databases has become more prominent, enabling more advanced analytics and task automation.
descripcion.tx14: Development of New Technologies: The evolution continues with the development of new technologies such as distributed databases, in-memory databases, and federated data management systems.

descripcion.tx1: Firebase is a super tool in development to be the core of information, adaptable in our beginnings as developers.

db-firebase.descripcionCorta: This is a guide of elements that you must manage to connect your application to Firebase.

descripcion.tx1: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language designed to manage and manipulate relational databases. Used in database management systems (DBMS), SQL allows queries, updates, insertions and deletions of data in tables. Its syntax is divided into categories such as DDL (Data Definition Language) to define the database structure and DML (Data Manipulation Language) to manipulate data. Common commands include SELECT to retrieve data, INSERT to add new records, UPDATE to modify existing records and DELETE to delete records. Its wide adoption and versatility make it a fundamental tool for data management.

db-sql.descripcionCorta: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language designed to manage and manipulate relational databases.

descripcion.tx1: Firebase is a super tool in development to be the core of information, adaptable in our beginnings as developers.

db-sql-server.descripcionCorta: This is a guide of elements that you must manage to connect your application to Firebase.

descripcion.tx1: The current scenario for developing software is through a code editor and the machine that will execute the commands and logic. This being so, the origin involves these.
descripcion.tx2: Beginning in the 1940s, the first electronic computers, such as the ENIAC and UNIVAC, were created for specific purposes. Programmers wrote instructions directly into machine code.
descripcion.tx3: In the 1950s the first languages starting with 'Fortran' the first high-level programming language, designed for scientific and engineering programming, developed by IBM.
descripcion.tx4: The first programming language designed for artificial intelligence 'Lips' in 1958, developed by John McCarthy.
descripcion.tx5: In the 1960s, 'COBOL' was created for commercial and administrative applications.
descripcion.tx6: In 1969 Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie developed the Unix operating system at Bell Labs, which had a significant impact on software development.
descripcion.tx7: In the 1970s structured programming emerged, in 1972 Dennis Ritchie and Brian Kernighan developed the C programming language, which became the basis for the Unix operating system and many other systems. Structured programming, a methodology that emphasizes code clarity and efficiency, became popular.
descripcion.tx8: In 1980 decade for object-oriented programming, in 1983 Bjarne Stroustrup developed C++, a programming language that extended C with object-oriented programming features, later gaining even more popularity with languages such as Smalltalk, C++ and Java.
descripcion.tx9: In the 1990s in 1991 Web development accelerated with the creation of the World Wide Web by Tim Berners-Lee.
descripcion.tx10: In 1995 Java was launched by Sun Microsystems, becoming a key language for the development of enterprise and web applications.
descripcion.tx11: In 2001, the Agile Manifesto was launched, giving rise to agile software development practices that prioritize collaboration, adaptability and continuous delivery.
descripcion.tx12: In 2005 Ruby on Rails simplified web development with its focus on convention over configuration. Cloud computing became more prominent, allowing easy access to infrastructure resources.
descripcion.tx13: In 2010 The rise of mobile applications, driven by iOS and Android, led to an increase in mobile application development. DevOps (Development + Operations): Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) became essential with the widespread adoption of DevOps approaches.
descripcion.tx14: In 2020 The integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning in applications became more common. Low-code development platforms emerged that allow users with less technical expertise to create applications without intensive programming.

descripcion.tx1: Proven recommendations in the job search.
descripcion.tx2: This publication is a reflection of my own process to get a job as a frontend developer. At the beginning of the publication I am looking for a good company, when I finish it the idea is to suggest which points worked.
descripcion.tx3: The objective seen in a simple way is to sell ourselves as a product of commerce (in context only). These are the points that I suggest to take into account.

dev-busqueda-empleo.descripcionCorta: Recommendations and suggestions in the job search. It shows a process to take into account in this path.
dev-busqueda-empleo.predisposicion1: Before we tell the world that we are looking for a job, we must first know it inside. For obvious reasons, if you are looking for a job, it is presumably because you are totally convinced.
dev-busqueda-empleo.predisposicion2: Predisposition alone ends up being the major force that will connect everything.
dev-busqueda-empleo.predisposicion3: There is no point in starting a search without having it as an expendable goal in life.
dev-busqueda-empleo.ejercicio1: All that can be done in a healthy way.
dev-busqueda-empleo.ejercicio2: There are too many benefits associated with sport, especially what is sought after from this part is serotonin, the body's natural happy substance.
dev-busqueda-empleo.ejercicio3: That it accompanies every day as part of the routine of the search.
dev-busqueda-empleo.curriculum1: Without a doubt, a resume with your personal, educational and professional information is required.
dev-busqueda-empleo.curriculum2: In this case I suggest these online resources where you can organize all your information:

cv.cv1: Resume formats, portfolios, legal letter formats, etc.
cv.cv2: Create your resume in just 5 minutes
cv.cv3: Your Curriculum Vitae fast, easy to use and professional
cv.cv4: Create your resume like a professional
cv.cv5: Create a job-ready resume in minutes
cv.cv7: Your success story starts with a resume

carta.tx1: It is a personal letter that will introduce you to the company or position you are applying for.
carta.tx2: The words contained are usually very personal, the amazing thing about today is that if you ask artificial intelligence for help, it usually hits the nail on the head with inspiration.
carta.tx3: "Currently, I have been focused on frontend development in Angular, with more than 5 years of experience. I like to work in a team, seek continuous training, apply new knowledge in development, and put my creativity and heart in my daily work. I also consider life and the time we have an opportunity and a blessing to share the passion that makes us unique, and that the world expects and needs to thrive."...

marketplace.tx1: Employment agencies determine the labor focal point, this is where we are a product that must stand out to be seen and taken into account.
marketplace.tx2: The outlook is favorable or not depending on the supply and demand of applicants, if there are few we will be very valuable and many things can be overlooked such as not fully mastering a technology or a senior position is required and ends up getting a semi, things like that.
marketplace.tx3: In this case, let us consider that the outlook is not favorable and that it is up to us to find a way to stand out from the crowd.
marketplace.tx4: If we have friends or relatives who can give us a direct recommendation in the company, let's use this possibility. A recruiter sees someone recommended better than a stranger initially.

linkedin.tx1: The agencies' mom for employment with a much more complete sense focused on social networks.
linkedin.tx2: For this part it is required to make a personal marketing taking into account these points:

puntos.tx1: Expand my network with valuable contacts, according to my profile and what I am looking for.
puntos.tx2: You need to be publishing valuable content.
puntos.tx3: Comment, make strong propositive comments, for example: "wow" what a great article because...
puntos.tx4: Write an attractive summary highlighting achievements and value propositions.
puntos.tx5: Add custom message when sending connection requests, to explain why you want to connect.
puntos.tx6: Follow companies that interest me and company recruiters.
puntos.tx7: Join groups related to your industry or area of interest, participate in conversations, share knowledge and establish valuable connections.

linkedin.tx3: You are required to fill in a series of fields that ask you very repetitively, personal data, study 1, study 2, company 1, company 2...
linkedin.tx4: Even if they are already included in the resume.

entrevista.tx1: In some ways this is very similar to the date you get with the girl you like.
entrevista.tx2: It is a big step and should be seen as a business in which both parties are looking for what there is to gain. For example, salary is an issue that both parties have an interest in and it is a point in which we must know how our profession is valued in the market.
entrevista.tx3: Even if you feel very confident because you have done well in previous companies, or, if the opposite is the case and nerves did their damage, in both cases you should know the common questions and be clear that you must answer them without falsehoods.
entrevista.tx4: This is an excellent site with free interview preparation materials selected for busy people.
entrevista.tx5: These are some of the most common questions asked for each case:

bl1.sugerencia: This is an open-ended question that gives you the opportunity to talk about your experience, interests, and personal and professional goals.

bl2.pregunta: WHY ARE YOU INTERESTED IN WORKING IN OUR COMPANY?
bl2.sugerencia: Interviewers want to know if you have researched the company and if you share their values and goals.

bl3.pregunta: WHAT IS YOUR EXPERIENCE WORKING IN SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT TEAMS?
bl3.sugerencia: Here you may be asked about your communication skills, collaboration and adaptation to team dynamics.

bl4.pregunta: CAN YOU DESCRIBE A CHALLENGING PROJECT YOU HAVE WORKED ON AND HOW YOU OVERCAME IT?
bl4.sugerencia: This question assesses your problem-solving skills and your ability to meet challenges.

bl5.pregunta: HOW DO YOU KEEP UP TO DATE WITH THE LATEST TRENDS AND TECHNOLOGIES IN SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT?
bl5.sugerencia: Interviewers want to know if you are a professional who keeps learning and stays current.

bl6.pregunta: DO YOU HAVE ANY EXPERIENCE WORKING ON AGILE PROJECTS OR SPECIFIC DEVELOPMENT METHODOLOGIES?
bl6.sugerencia: You may be asked about your adaptability and experience in specific development environments.

bl7.pregunta: WHAT MOTIVATES YOU IN YOUR CAREER AS A SOFTWARE DEVELOPER?
bl7.sugerencia: Here you can talk about your career goals and what excites you in software development.

bl8.pregunta: HOW DO YOU HANDLE STRESS AND TIGHT DEADLINES?
bl8.sugerencia: This question assesses your ability to deal with high-pressure situations.

bl9.pregunta: DO YOU HAVE EXPERIENCE IN LEADERSHIP OR MANAGEMENT OF DEVELOPMENT TEAMS?
bl9.sugerencia: This could explore your potential to take on leadership roles in the future.

bl10.pregunta: WHAT IS YOUR APPROACH TO CODE QUALITY AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT PRACTICES?
bl10.sugerencia: Interviewers may be interested in your commitment to quality and continuous improvement.

bl1.pregunta: WHAT WAS THE LAST COMPANY WHERE YOU WORKED?

bl2.pregunta: TELL US ABOUT YOUR EXPERIENCE IN THE LAST COMPANY?

bl3.pregunta: WHAT WAS YOUR BIGGEST CHALLENGE IN THIS COMPANY AND WHY?

bl1.pregunta: UP TO WHAT LEVEL DID YOU STUDY?

bl2.pregunta: DO YOU HAVE A MASTER'S DEGREE OR DIPLOMA?

bl1.pregunta: DO YOU HAVE EXPERIENCE IN TYPESCRIPT AND JAVASCRIPT DESIGN PATTERNS?

bl2.pregunta: DO YOU HAVE EXPERIENCE IN ATOMIC DESIGN ARCHITECTURE?

bl1.pregunta: WHICH HTML ATTRIBUTE IS USED TO DEFINE INLINE STYLES?

bl2.pregunta: WHICH HTML TAG IS USED TO DEFINE AN EXTERNAL STYLE SHEET?
bl2.ejemplo: It is the link tag and the path is added in the src attribute.

bl3.pregunta: WHICH PSEUDO CLASS IS USED TO DEFINE A PROPERTY WHEN THE MOUSE CURSOR IS PLACED OVER AN ELEMENT?
bl3.ejemplo: The pseudo hover class preceded by a colon.

bl4.pregunta: IN CSS WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN MARGIN AND PADDING PROPERTIES?
bl4.ejemplo: Margin is the space outside the DOM element and padding is applied inside the body of the DOM element to which the class is being applied.

bl5.pregunta: WHAT DOES THE ACRONYM CSS STAND FOR?

bl6.pregunta: IN CSS3 WHAT DO THE "A" IN RGBA?
bl6.ejemplo: The 4 stand for R:red, G:green, B:blue, A:alpha (transparency).

bl7.pregunta: HOW DO YOU ASSIGN STYLES FOR DIFFERENT DEVICES AND RESOLUTIONS?
bl7.ejemplo: Through the @media property within the cascading styles.

bl8.pregunta: WHAT WOULD YOU BE DEFINING WHEN USING FLEX-DIRECTION: COLUMN; IN AN ELEMENT WITH DISPLAY: FLEX;?
bl8.ejemplo: that the elements inside the display: flex are formed as a column.

bl9.pregunta: EXPLAINS THE FUNCTION OF @IMPORT IN SASS
bl9.ejemplo: The purpose of the @import directive is to connect several SASS or SCSS files to a file of type SASS or SCSS, in order to sort the code separately.

bl10.pregunta: EXPLAINS THE FUNCTION OF @EXTEND IN SASS
bl10.ejemplo: This directive has a special quality in that it allows inheriting characteristics from one class or selector to another selector, avoiding the repetition of styles.

bl11.pregunta: EXPLAINS WHEN YOU CAN USE THE % PLACEHOLDER IN SASS
bl11.ejemplo: It is used when creating a group of styles %name {css features}, after being created it works inside a class when referring to the inheritance of %name and therefore inherits the styles, like this: .class { @extend %name;}

bl12.pregunta: EXPLAIN IN YOUR OWN WORDS HOW MIXINS (@MIXIN) IN SASS CAN BE USEFUL
bl12.ejemplo: It allows you to reuse CSS styles and properties in your stylesheets in a modular and efficient way. A great utility is to be able to pass parameters to a previously created @mixin and use all the features of that @mixin with the parameter that is sent.

bl13.pregunta: IN HTML, THE TITLE ATTRIBUTE IS USED FOR:
bl13.ejemplo: It is to provide additional information about an element when the user hovers over it.

bl21.pregunta: WHAT STRUCTURE DOES THE DOM FOLLOW?
bl21.sugerencia: The DOM, or Document Object Model, follows a hierarchy, where a main node named "root node" represents the entire document. From this root node, nodes branch out to represent the elements of the document, such as HTML tags, attributes and text content. These nodes are connected to each other in a hierarchical fashion, reflecting the nested structure of the original document.
